summary: The Coordinated Federal Response to Extreme Heat Act of 2025 aims to reduce health risks from extreme heat. It establishes the National Integrated Heat Health Information System (NIHHIS) within NOAA and the National Integrated Heat Health Information System Interagency Committee. The Committee will coordinate federal agencies to improve preparedness, planning, and response to extreme heat events. The bill outlines data collection, research, and outreach initiatives, and authorizes appropriations for the system's operation and implementation.
